item.title: A Heretic Can Never Become The Pope - Catholic Teaching
Great Proof Texts For Sedevacantism Show That Francis Is Not The Pope
item.description: By Bro. Peter Dimond, O.S.B. Source: vaticancatholic.com This video will cover some very important passages that deal with the Catholic Church’s teaching that someone who holds office in the Church, but preaches notorious heresy, loses authority from the moment that he preaches the heresy, even if no declaration has been made against him. St. Robert Bellarmine, De Romano Pontifice, Book 2, Chap. 30: “... a manifestly heretical Pope automatically ceases to be the Pope and the head just as he automatically ceases to be a Christian and a member of the body of the Church, and that for this reason he may be judged and punished by the Church.
